content:
TITLE: Initializing Datadog RUM in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to initialize Datadog Real User Monitoring in a web application. The configuration includes required parameters like applicationId, clientToken, and site, as well as optional settings for tracking resources, long tasks, and user interactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/rum/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { datadogRum } from '@datadog/browser-rum'

datadogRum.init({
  applicationId: '<DATADOG_APPLICATION_ID>',
  clientToken: '<DATADOG_CLIENT_TOKEN>',
  site: '<DATADOG_SITE>',
  //  service: 'my-web-application',
  //  env: 'production',
  //  version: '1.0.0',
  sessionSampleRate: 100,
  sessionReplaySampleRate: 100,
  trackResources: true,
  trackLongTasks: true,
  trackUserInteractions: true,
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Datadog Browser Logs SDK in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize the Datadog browser logs SDK. It sets up the client token, site, error forwarding, and session sample rate.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/logs/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { datadogLogs } from '@datadog/browser-logs'

datadogLogs.init({
  clientToken: '<DATADOG_CLIENT_TOKEN>',
  site: '<DATADOG_SITE>',
  forwardErrorsToLogs: true,
  sessionSampleRate: 100,
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Custom Logs with Datadog Browser Logs SDK in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to send custom log entries to Datadog using the initialized SDK. It includes examples of sending an info log and an error log with additional context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/logs/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { datadogLogs } from '@datadog/browser-logs'

datadogLogs.logger.info('Button clicked', { name: 'buttonName', id: 123 })

try {
  ...
  throw new Error('Wrong behavior')
  ...
} catch (ex) {
  datadogLogs.logger.error('Error occurred', { team: 'myTeam' }, ex)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Browser Compatibility Matrix in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table showing browser compatibility for various Datadog Browser SDK features including RUM tracking, error monitoring, and performance metrics. Includes support status for desktop and mobile browsers with specific limitations noted.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/rum/BROWSER_SUPPORT.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Feature           | Chrome | Firefox | Safari | Edge | Chrome Android | Safari iOS | IE  | Opera |
| ----------------- | ------ | ------- | ------ | ---- | -------------- | ---------- | --- | ----- |
| loading           | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| init              | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| rum request       | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| flush on hide     | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚ùå         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| console error     | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| runtime error     | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| CSP violation     | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| intervention      | ‚úÖ     | ‚ùå      | ‚ùå     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚ùå         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| auto action       | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| custom action     | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| long task         | ‚úÖ     | ‚ùå      | ‚ùå     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚ùå         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| tracing           | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| route change      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| loading time      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| resource timing   | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚ö†Ô∏è(2)  | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚ö†Ô∏è(2)      | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| navigation timing | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| web vitals        | ‚úÖ     | ‚ö†Ô∏è(1)   | ‚ö†Ô∏è(1)  | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚ö†Ô∏è(1)      | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
| FCP               | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ      | ‚úÖ     | ‚úÖ   | ‚úÖ             | ‚úÖ         | ‚ùå  | ‚úÖ    |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server for Datadog Browser SDK
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server using yarn. The server will be accessible at http://localhost:8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/sandbox/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Browser SDK Developer Extension
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the repository, install dependencies, and build the extension. This is necessary if loading the extension unpacked instead of from the Chrome Web Store.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/developer-extension/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/DataDog/browser-sdk
$ cd browser-sdk
$ yarn
$ yarn build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching Events in the Event Tab
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the key:value search syntax to filter events in the Event Tab of the extension. This demonstrates how to search for specific event types and attributes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/developer-extension/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
type:view application.id:2 action.target.name:my_action_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Browser SDK Performance Tests
DESCRIPTION: Commands for executing performance tests using different versions of the Datadog Browser SDK. The default command uses datadog-rum.js while the --recorder flag enables testing with datadog-rum-recorder.js.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/performances/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn start
yarn start --recorder
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Session Start State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing possible transitions when starting a session, including transitions from NotStarted to Expired and handling of active sessions
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>
state fork_state2 <<fork>>

[*] --> fork_state

fork_state --> NotStarted
fork_state --> Expired
fork_state --> Tracked
fork_state --> NotTracked
NotStarted --> Expired: startSession()

Expired --> fork_state2
Tracked --> fork_state2
NotTracked --> fork_state2
fork_state2 --> [*]: expandOrRenew()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Expand or Renew State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing the expand or renew process including tracking type computation
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>
state fork_state2 <<fork>>
state fork_state3 <<fork>>


state expandOrRenew() {
  [*] --> fork_state: expandOrRenew()
  Tracked2: Tracked
  NotTracked2: NotTracked

  fork_state --> NotStarted
  fork_state --> Expired
  fork_state --> Tracked
  fork_state --> NotTracked

  NotStarted --> [*]

  Expired --> fork_state2: renew()
  Tracked --> fork_state2: extend()
  NotTracked --> fork_state2: extend()

  fork_state2 --> fork_state3: computeTrackingType()

  fork_state3 --> Tracked2
  fork_state3 --> NotTracked2

  Tracked2 --> [*]
  NotTracked2 --> [*]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extend or Expire State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing the extend or expire process for different session states
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>

state extendOrExpire() {
  [*] --> fork_state : extendOrExpire()
  Tracked2: Tracked
  NotTracked2: NotTracked
  Expired2: Expired

  fork_state --> NotStarted
  fork_state --> Expired
  fork_state --> Tracked
  fork_state --> NotTracked

  Tracked --> Tracked2: extend()
  NotTracked --> NotTracked2: extend()
  Expired --> Expired2: expire()

  NotStarted --> [*]
  Tracked2 --> [*]
  NotTracked2 --> [*]
  Expired2 --> [*]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: User Activity State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing session state transitions triggered by user activity
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>

[*] --> fork_state

fork_state --> [*]: expandOrRenew()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Visibility Change State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing how visibility changes affect session state, handling both visible and hidden states
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>
state visibility <<choice>>

[*] --> visibility: VisibilityChange

visibility --> [*]: hidden
visibility --> fork_state : visible

fork_state --> [*]: extendOrExpire()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Frozen State Resume Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing session state management when resuming from a frozen state
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>
state fork_state2 <<fork>>

[*] --> fork_state: Resume

fork_state --> NotStarted
fork_state --> Expired
fork_state --> Tracked
fork_state --> NotTracked

NotStarted --> Expired: restartSession()
Expired --> fork_state2
Tracked --> fork_state2
NotTracked --> fork_state2

fork_state2 --> [*]: extendOrExpire()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Watch Timer State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing periodic session state checks performed every second
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>


[*] --> fork_state
fork_state --> [*]: extendOrExpire()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cookie Clearing State Flow
DESCRIPTION: State diagram showing session state transitions when cookies are cleared by third parties
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/src/domain/session/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
stateDiagram-v2
state fork_state <<fork>>
state join_state <<join>>
NotStarted2: NotStarted

[*] --> fork_state

fork_state --> NotStarted
fork_state --> Expired
fork_state --> Tracked
fork_state --> NotTracked

Expired --> join_state
Tracked --> join_state
NotTracked --> join_state
NotStarted --> join_state

join_state --> NotStarted2 : clearCookies()

NotStarted2 --> [*]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Gitmoji-inspired Commit Message Convention in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet showcases the commit message convention used in the project, inspired by gitmoji. It lists various emoji and their corresponding meanings for both user-facing and internal changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### User-facing changes

üí• - Breaking change.

‚ú® - New feature.

üêõ - Bug fix.

‚ö°Ô∏è - Performance improvement.

üìù - Documentation.

‚öó - Experimental.

### Internal changes

üë∑ - Updating project setup (continuous integration, build system, package dependencies...).

‚ôªÔ∏è - Refactoring code.

üé® - Improving structure / format of the code.

‚úÖ - Updating tests.

üëå - Updating code due to code review changes.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Core Module Description in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A simple markdown header and description for the core module of the Datadog browser SDK. This documentation indicates that the module contains browser core utilities for Datadog.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/core/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# `core`

Datadog browser core utilities.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Datadog Browser RUM Core Package in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the package name 'rum-core' for Datadog browser RUM core utilities. It provides a brief description of the package's purpose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/rum-core/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
# `rum-core`

Datadog browser RUM core utilities.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Web Worker Header Definition in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown header defining the web worker module name and providing a brief description of the Datadog browser web Worker functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/browser-sdk/blob/main/packages/worker/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# `worker`

Datadog browser web Worker.
```
